qas.question: Ottoman artists mixed Chinese art with the art of what else?
The ottoman empire built structures in Romania that included Mosques, and Bridges, what else was built?
Why did the art of the Ottoman empire develop the way it did?

answers.text: the wide ethnic range of the Ottoman Empire

qas.question: Beside Edirne, Istanbul, and Egypt what other locations can one find the influence of the Ottoman classical period?

answers.text: Eritrea, Tunisia, Algiers, the Balkans and Romania

context: Examples of Ottoman architecture of the classical period, besides Istanbul and Edirne, can also be seen in Egypt, <a3_0>Eritrea, Tunisia, Algiers, the Balkans and Romania<a3_0/>, where mosques, bridges, <a1_0>fountains and schools<a1_0/> were built. The art of Ottoman decoration developed with a multitude of influences due to <a2_0>the wide ethnic range of the Ottoman Empire<a2_0/>. The greatest of the court artists enriched the Ottoman Empire with many pluralistic artistic influences: such as mixing <a0_0>traditional Byzantine art<a0_0/> with elements of Chinese art.
